name: Rent Arrears
short_description: Tenant has been in rent arrears for three consecutive months

notice_requirement.minimum_period: 28 days (if in arrears at notice date), or 84 days (if not in arrears)
notice_requirement.tribunal_application: Can apply to First-tier Tribunal after notice period expires

notice_period.notice_to_leave: 28 days (if rent arrears at notice date) OR 84 days (if not)

evidence_required: Tenancy agreement with rent amount and due dates

high_probability: Clear three consecutive months of arrears
Reasonable for Tribunal to grant eviction

costs.tribunal_fee: Free for tenants, landlords pay modest fees

tenant_defenses: Not reasonable for tribunal to grant
notes: Scotland Ground 1 is similar to England's Ground 8 but no longer mandatory - Tribunal has discretion. Pre-action requirements (Pre-Action Requirements (Notice to Leave and Notice of Proceedings) (Scotland) Regulations 2020) are STRICT. Must show attempts to resolve arrears before eviction.

steps: Give information about rent arrears and consequences
Provide information on sources of advice and assistance
Give tenant reasonable time to pay or discuss
Make reasonable attempts to agree payment plan
pre_action_requirements.evidence: Must provide evidence to Tribunal that these were followed
pre_action_requirements.failure: Tribunal likely to refuse eviction if not followed

case_law: Hunter v Tindale [2020] - Pre-action requirements must be followed
Aberdeen City Council v Lutz [2021] - Tribunal considers reasonableness
tribunal_considerations: Has payment plan been proposed or tried?
Is eviction reasonable in all circumstances?
